subjectsSection.title: 1st Year
subjects: Introduction to Library and Information Science
Information and Communications Technology in LIS
Library Materials for Children and Young Adult
Telecommunications and Networks for Library Information Science

subjectsSection.title: 2nd Year
subjects: Information Processing and Handling in Libraries and Information Centers
Management of Libraries and Information Centers
Web Technologies in Libraries and Information Centers

subjectsSection.title: 3rd Year
subjects: Introduction to Records Management and Archives
Philosophies and Principles of Teaching in Lis
Systems Analysis and Design in Libraries and Information Centers
Research Methods in Library and Information Science
Review in Organization, Management and Development and Maintenance of Multi-media based Library or Information Service, Laws, Trends and Practices affecting the Profession

careerSection.title: Academic Librarian
careerSection.description: Manage and organize collections in universities, supporting students and faculty with research needs.

careerSection.title: Archivist
careerSection.description: Preserve, manage, and provide access to historical documents, manuscripts, and digital archives.

careerSection.title: Cataloger
careerSection.description: Classify and organize library resources using standard cataloging systems.

careerSection.title: Records Manager
careerSection.description: Oversee the creation, maintenance, and disposal of an organizationâ€™s records for legal and operational needs.

careerSection.title: Information Specialist
careerSection.description: Support organizations by managing digital information resources and research databases.

careerSection.title: Public Librarian
careerSection.description: Work in community libraries to provide access to books, resources, and educational programs.

careerSection.title: Digital Librarian
careerSection.description: Manage and curate digital collections, ensuring accessibility and preservation of e-resources.

careerSection.title: Knowledge Manager
careerSection.description: Develop systems and practices that capture, share, and leverage organizational knowledge.
